Emerging growth company&#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#9744; &#160; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the Registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160;&#9744; Item 5.07&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. &#160; The 2024 Annual Meeting of Shareholders (the &#8220;Annual Meeting&#8221;) of Apple Inc. (&#8220;Apple&#8221;) was held on &#160; February&#160;28, 2024 . At the Annual Meeting, Apple&#8217;s shareholders voted on the following eight proposals and cast their votes as described below. 1. The individuals listed below were elected at the Annual Meeting to serve as directors of Apple until the next annual meeting of shareholders and until their successors are duly elected and qualified: &#160; &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote Wanda Austin &#160; 9,071,238,739 &#160; 41,808,115 &#160; 20,441,053 &#160; 3,275,055,901 Tim Cook &#160; 8,981,334,503 &#160; 138,150,021 &#160; 14,003,383 &#160; 3,275,055,901 Alex Gorsky &#160; 8,952,997,553 &#160; 160,822,837 &#160; 19,667,517 &#160; 3,275,055,901 Andrea Jung &#160; 8,629,655,897 &#160; 484,800,970 &#160; 19,031,040 &#160; 3,275,055,901 Art Levinson &#160; 8,552,669,663 &#160; 561,437,085 &#160; 19,381,159 &#160; 3,275,055,901 Monica Lozano &#160; 9,039,170,194 &#160; 74,381,943 &#160; 19,935,770 &#160; 3,275,055,901 Ron Sugar &#160; 8,787,482,632 &#160; 325,339,831 &#160; 20,665,444 &#160; 3,275,055,901 Sue Wagner &#160; 8,957,887,476 &#160; 155,887,705 &#160; 19,712,726 &#160; 3,275,055,901 2. A management proposal to ratify the appointment of Ernst &amp; Young LLP as Apple&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2024 was approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained 12,211,115,276 &#160; 164,034,315 &#160; 33,394,217 3. An advisory resolution to approve executive compensation was approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 8,385,653,963 &#160; 702,309,882 &#160; 45,524,062 &#160; 3,275,055,901 4. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220; EEO Policy Risk Report &#8221; was not approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 116,754,721 &#160; 8,911,884,765 &#160; 104,848,421 &#160; 3,275,055,901 5. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220; Report on Ensuring Respect for Civil Liberties &#8221; was not approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 164,816,396 &#160; 8,853,955,511 &#160; 114,716,000 &#160; 3,275,055,901 6. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220; Racial and Gender Pay Gaps &#8221; was not approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 2,817,465,452 &#160; 6,248,518,245 &#160; 67,504,210 &#160; 3,275,055,901 7. A shareholder proposal requesting a report on the use of AI was not approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 3,333,209,334 &#160; 5,549,219,868 &#160; 251,058,705 &#160; 3,275,055,901 8. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Congruency Report on Privacy and Human Rights&#8221; was not approved. For &#160; Against &#160; Abstained &#160; Broker Non-Vote 147,994,563 &#160; 8,879,045,656 &#160; 106,447,688 &#160; 3,275,055,901 SIGNATURE &#160; Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized. &#160; Date: February 28, 2024 &#160; Apple Inc. &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; By: &#160; /s/ Katherine Adams &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; Katherine Adams &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary
